page.title: 15Scotton/Northorpe: Law/Order
page.content: Fortunately crime does not feature large in this area, though there have been a few house burglaries recently, reports of a prowler and cases of minor vandalism: disturbing enough to a village but insignificant compared with what is apparently commonplace in larger villages and in towns. Lincoln- shire police policy now favours "Commu -nity Policing" and local policemen are encourage to get to know (and be known by) the people in their area: in particular they are asked to attend parish council meetings. Certainly P C Gerry Thorold, based at Scotter, is better known than his predecessors and is working hard to establish a rela- tionship where people tell him of any- thing untoward and feel able to call on him for help where appropriate. In October 1985 he spoke to an open W.I. meeting in Scotton on Solvent Abuse.
